text:
so the root event is completely independent from time, so it can run whenever it wants to, it just needs to run at least "often enough" to make whatever you're doing work. How much fidelity you need you can configure in your clock instance.

In theory the root event doesn't have to be a time-based loop (only), it could also wake up on other events that operators hinted at (e.g. incoming MIDI messages) for tighter timing.

text: Thinking more about this, I think you might find checking out React interesting if you haven't - forget hooks, just the main component-based ideas feel very relevant.

elements.text: Thinking more about this, I think you might find checking out React interesting if you haven't - forget hooks, just the main component-based ideas feel very relevant.

text: <@UE3KC0VK6> I've worked professionally with pre-hooks react for a while, it is definitely quite relevant. In react component identity is done via the "key" prop, and some diffing magic, here it is explicit via tagging. Instead of shouldComponentUpdate and context there is dependency-tracking.

text: Ah cool, just making sure you weren't missing out, could be useful in communicating these ideas to certain groups too.
